fields.bio: As a Computer Science and Mathematics major at Amherst College, I’ve worked on projects ranging from building machine learning models to developing dynamic web applications. Whether it’s automating workflows, designing predictive models, or crafting full-stack solutions, I thrive on turning complex problems into impactful technology. When I’m not coding, you’ll find me on the soccer field or busy playing and exploring new music. I’m always eager to learn, grow, and use technology to create solutions that make a significant impact on others.

fields.title: Data Scientist Intern
fields.description: Managed data within Databricks and Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3 environments to automate data aggregation and processing pipelines. Developed Python, R, and SQL scripts to identify data-driven insights and create visualizations to support soccer analytics and sports science. Implemented unsupervised learning algorithms and neural networks to assist in player recruitment within the Shiny platform.

fields.title: Data Analyst Intern
fields.company: Impulsora del Deportivo Necaxa S.A. de C.V.
fields.description: Developed a comprehensive online platform with player and league data for the Scouting Department of Liga MX Professional Soccer Team. Streamlined the player recruitment process through the identification of key attributes and statistics. Built projects using Python, SQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Google Sites, and Google Sheets.

fields.title: Mathematics Tutor
fields.description: Developed lesson plans and tutored students aged 7-16 in pre-algebra through calculus. Generated weekly student progress reports for parent and teacher review.

fields.title: AI / ML Engineering Intern
fields.description: Developed a clustering and NLP-based segmentation system in AWS Bedrock that identified high-value audience segments, directly contributing to new customer acquisition and revenue lift. Built an automated data evaluation pipeline using OpenAI LLMs and Google Sheets API, eliminating a previously manual supplier vetting process across client and analytics teams. Deployed end-to-end workflows via Airflow and AWS Lambda, integrating with S3 and Snowflake for scalable, production-level automation. Contributed to weekly customer data processing and delivery, supporting pipeline maintenance, debugging, and data analysis using Zeppelin and Sigma. Collaborated across remote teams using Bitbucket and Jira, gaining experience with version control, agile workflows, and cross-functional project coordination.

fields.title: Senior Honors Thesis
fields.description: Conducting an honors thesis on Text-to-SQL modeling, exploring how large language models (LLMs) can serve as natural language interfaces to databases. Applying logical equivalence checking to improve evaluation and majority voting across SQL-generating models, building on frameworks like VeriEQL and Mediator. Aiming to enhance accessibility and robustness of data querying for non-technical users by enabling semantically meaningful comparisons between SQL queries. Collaborating with Amherst faculty among other researchers; final results to be formally published and presented as part of a senior honors defense.

fields.name: Match Prediction Model
fields.description: Developed a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) using PyTorch to predict professional soccer match outcomes based on historical betting data (2002-2023). Improved prediction accuracy by optimizing hyperparameters and analyzing model performance metrics.

fields.name: Player Market Value Shiny App
fields.description: Built an interactive Shiny web application analyzing factors influencing soccer player market values. Applied clustering algorithms to identify trends and segments in player valuations.

fields.name: Personal Website
fields.description: Personal website built using React, Django, and PostgreSQL.
During COVID, I taught myself to play piano by ear. I learned two classical pieces — Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata (Movement I) and Chopin's Nocturne in E-flat major, Op. 9, No. 2.
NCAA Student-Athlete - Midfielder. 2024 NCAA DIII National Champion, 2022 & 2023 NESCAC Tournament Champions, 2023 & 2024 NESCAC All-Academic Honors.

I’ve always loved learning about the past. Alongside my studies in computer science and math, I’ve made time to explore history through books, documentaries, and travel. I’m especially drawn to Napoleonic Europe, the American Revolution, and the ancient Mediterranean as they reveal so much about how the modern world was shaped.

In the spring of 2025, I had the opportunity to study abroad in Madrid, Spain for the semester. Over the course of three months, I had the amazing experience of traveling throughout Spain and Western Europe. I visited lots of places in Spain, including Barcelona, Santiago de Compostela, Sevilla, Mallorca, and more. I also got to see London, Paris, and spend a week in Italy where I traveled through Venice, Florence, Milan, Rome, Naples and Pompeii, and the Amalfi Coast. In the future, I hope to travel to Eastern Europe and Asia to experience these amazing countries and cultures!
